comments.body: Missing an error here. Is this what #44459 is supposed to fix?
There don't seem to be any errors here after the merge. Is this something you're still working on?
It's unexpected. I'll to try to find out soon.

It's very strange. There's diagnostic messages at [playground](https://www.typescriptlang.org/play?alwaysStrict=false&ts=4.4.0-dev.20210622#code/IYZwngdgxgBAZgV2gFwJYHsL3emAKAShgG8AoGCmAGwFNkSZgB3YVegXxgF4TPRGIYUu1KlQkWIhQYsAI2AAnfETKUYUTCHrNW9HgEZho8dHhIoaTDHkAvZSXKUAbosYs23GIfZA). But nothing comes in test case.

Oh I got it. It's caused by `await;`.

You can see this [playground](https://www.typescriptlang.org/play?#code/IYZwngdgxgBAZgV2gFwJYHsL3emAKAShgG8AoGCmKTEZGYAd2FToF4YBGU8yx55ANykAvqSA).

Seems some diagnostic message will disappear when there's a `await;`;

I don't know why it happend but it seems could be track in another thread.

Ah, this is because we handle `await;` as a parse error in `+Await`, but `let { await }` is handled in the binder: https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/blob/3c71d54782789b76c1514e9dc37b42ee6a3a29fe/src/compiler/binder.ts#L2185-L2193

I would split this into two tests, one that has parse errors, and one that has static errors produced by the binder. The easiest thing to do would be to just cut out the tests that should be failing but aren't into a new test file.
